title: VA - Johnny Mnemonic (Music From The Motion Picture) (1995)@flac
description:
The soundtrack is better than the film. I liked the film, but the soundtrack is great. Track 8 (Alex Descends into Hell for a Bottle of Milk/Korova 1) is one of my top 10 songs of all time - try to find it elsewhere.
The only wastage on this disk is track 10, an obligatory bit of "soundtrack" music from the films composer. Everything else is really, really good. And yes, this is the disk that turned me on to Stabbing Westward. That is a good thing. 


This album is the perfect flashback to the 90's when cheesy but fun sci-fi movies could be made for less than a billion dollars.  All the bands and songs harken back to the early days of techno and electronic music when many still had a punk/rock upbringing. These bands' music can still be found today by enterprising music gurus, and they are definitely worth the listen. (Customers from Amazon)

 <a href="
http://i.imgur.com/qkTrAyX.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://i.imgur.com/qkTrAyX.jpg</a>

04. Orbital - Sad But True    [7:49]

07. God Lives Underwater - No More Love    [4:18]
08. Bono And The Edge - Alex Decends Into Hell For A Bottle Of Milk- Korova 1    [3:37]
09. Stabbing Westward - Nothing    [4:02]
10. Brad Fiedel - Send It Out    [5:18]



Track 1 is a bonus track and not featured in the motion picture.
